intro: Opuntia caracassana, commonly known as the Brazilian prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to Brazil. It is characterized by its flat, paddle-shaped stems, which are covered in spines and glochids. The plant produces large, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to red, typically blooming in the summer months. Its fruit, known as a tunai, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. Opuntia caracassana is adapted to arid environments and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
